Detailed Description

An Application representing the currently running application.

You cannot directly instantiate this class. You need to implement this classes' methods and use Application::init for correct initialisation. The constant thisapp is of the type ApplicationSelf. It contains some extra methods that are not available for ordinary applications.

Member Function Documentation

AppType Sylph::ApplicationSelf::appType (  ) 

Returns an enumerated type representing the implementation used to back this ApplicationSelf.

The returned value is set by Application::init.

Returns:
an enumeration corresponding to the implementation of ApplicationSelf used.

void Sylph::Application::init ( int  argc,
char *  argv[],
char *  apple[],
AppType  type 
) [static, inherited]

Initialize the current application.

This function will give the correct value to thisapp. Note that if you use int SylphMain(Array<String>) as the entry point for your application (the default), you do not need to call this function explicitly. Instead, it will be called for you before the SylphMain function. Depending on the implementation, this function may or may not set up other important resources.

Parameters:
argc The number of arguments passed to the entry point designated by the platform.
argv An array of C strings containing the arguments passed to the entry point designated by the platform. This array is expected to have a length of argc or more. If argc is larger than the actual length of argv, undefined behaviour may occur.
apple The so-called 'apple-vector', an array of chars unique to the Mac OS X-platform. This array is used to determine the location of the binary solely on the Mac platform and is the fourth argument to the main entry function. On other platforms, this array may be substituted by a NULL pointer. Substituting this array on the Mac platform for anything else than the actual apple vector passed to the main function may lead to undefined behaviour.
type An enumerated type representing the implementation to use for resource retrieval.

const String Sylph::Application::location (  )  [inline, inherited]

Returns the location of the file containing the object code of the application.

In case the application for which the location is requested is thisapp, he exact method used to determine the location is platform-dependant and may fail. In this case, the value is either set to an empty string or a garbage value. Depending on the implementation, an error may be raised as well during initialisation.

Returns:
the application's location.
